short_description: A land of ancient history and breathtaking landscapes, Ethiopia is a country that has something for everyone. Explore the stunning Simien Mountains, discover the ancient ruins of Aksum, and immerse yourself in the vibrant culture of Addis Ababa

weather.title: Ethiopia has a diverse climate due to its varying topography, with a mix of tropical, subtropical, and highland climates. The country experiences two main seasons: a dry season from October to May, characterized by cooler temperatures and minimal rainfall, and a rainy season from June to September, when higher temperatures and significant rainfall are more common

when_to_visit.title: Dry season
when_to_visit.short_description: Cooler temperatures, minimal rainfall, and optimal conditions for exploring highlights like Addis Ababa and the Simien Mountains

when_to_visit.title: Wet season
when_to_visit.short_description: Heavy rainfall particularly in the highlands and central regions. Some roads and remote areas may be inaccessible during this season

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Ethiopia is during the dry season from October to May when the weather is generally mild and pleasant, allowing for comfortable exploration of the country's historical sites, diverse landscapes, and vibrant cultural events
